River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, but the crowning descision on director Jane Campion's part is hiring / attempting to hire American actress Sally Hawkins for her "New Zealand accent". It is a nightmare.
This film would make an excellent History Channel special, but is no where near good enough for big screen release.
